front.reference: Proceedings of Symposia in Pure Mathematics
front.div:
Abstract. Krichever–Novikov type algebras are generalizations of the Witt,
Virasoro, affine Lie algebras, and their relatives to Riemann surfaces of ar-
bitrary genus. We give the most important results about their structure,
almost-grading and central extensions. This contribution is based on a se-
quence of introductory lectures delivered by the author at the Southeast Lie
Theory Workshop 2012 in Charleston, U.S.A.
